Entries.default: "Serafen, I am glad that you were able to see Remaro one last time before he left."
"Serafen, I am sorry about what happened to Remaro."
"Aye, it were worthwhile. Not that I ain't aiming to set eyes on the old sawbones again."
"Shouldn't've wasted the time, lass. The old salt weren't so steadfast and weather-wise after all."
"Only bastards not bound for the Wheel be the cock-rotten bastards who built it, lass."
"True enough, but with some luck, even they may someday get their due."
"Then let us work for better days ahead."
"Still, it is better to have had the chance than not."
"This Giacolo salt, he saved your life and you've now returned the favor, aye?"
"He did more than save my life, di verus. He made my life worth living. Saving him seems like too small a gesture."
"Got meself some grog stashed away, you decide you be wanting a pull or ten."
"Agracima. It is appreciated. I may take you up on that some night."
"Assuming the captain don't get us all good and dead first."
"The scales ain't never balanced, lass. Nor balancing them the point."
